parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The provided post does not contain a CMF number.  This is not conclusive evidence of non-propaganda, as CMF numbers are not always required for all types of political communication, especially those not directly advocating for a specific candidate.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post does not refer to any specific parliamentary candidate by name, surname, or any other clear identifier. The guests mentioned are not identified as parliamentary candidates.  Therefore, Article 36 (7) - a does not apply.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>The post is a paid advertisement on Facebook, a public platform.  The intended audience is the general public within the specified geographic targeting (primarily Bistrița-Năsăud County). Therefore, it addresses the wide population.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The post promotes a radio show ("Dialogul de Vineri") featuring guests discussing unspecified topics. While the show might touch upon political issues, the post itself doesn't explicitly aim to influence votes for or against any particular candidate in the parliamentary elections. There is no direct call to action related to voting. The objective appears to be promoting the radio show, not influencing the election.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>The post can be interpreted as promoting a journalistic endeavor (a radio show). The description suggests a discussion format, which is consistent with journalistic practices.  However, the lack of specific details about the discussion topics prevents a definitive conclusion on whether it adheres to journalistic standards of impartiality and objectivity.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>The post doesn't express a personal opinion; it promotes a radio show.  Therefore, this aspect is not relevant to the analysis.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1138349474474550</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The post promotes a radio show with guests. While the show's content might indirectly touch upon political matters, the advertisement itself lacks any direct or indirect call to vote for or against any specific candidate in the parliamentary elections. The primary objective seems to be promoting the radio show, not influencing the election outcome.  The absence of a CMF number is not sufficient to definitively classify it as non-propaganda, but given the lack of direct electoral advocacy, the post is unlikely to be considered electoral propaganda under Article 98 t).
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>Bistrita FM</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
